organization.fullName: Allegheny Singer Research Institute (also known as Allegheny Health Network Research Institute)

identificationModule.briefTitle: EXErcise Regimen Designed to Improve Functional Mobility, Body Composition, and Strength After Treatment for Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: EXERT-C: Prospective Study of an EXErcise Regimen Designed to Improve Functional Mobility, Body Composition, and Strength After Treatment for Cancer

leadSponsor.name: Allegheny Singer Research Institute (also known as Allegheny Health Network Research Institute)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This protocol seeks to analyze patient outcomes of the standard of care, monitored group exercise regimen of high-load resistance training and functional exercises with compound movements under close supervision on individuals who have been treated for cancer.

armGroups.label: General cancer patients
armGroups.description: All patients undergoing treatment for cancer on an exercise regimen

armGroups.label: Head and neck cancer patients
armGroups.description: All patients undergoing treatment for head and neck cancer on an exercise regime

armGroups.label: Colorectal cancer patients
armGroups.description: All patients undergoing treatment for colorectal cancer on an exercise regime

armGroups.label: Pancreatic cancer patients
armGroups.description: All patients undergoing treatment for pancreatic cancer on an exercise regime

armGroups.label: Metastatic breast cancer patients
armGroups.description: All patients undergoing treatment for metastatic breast cancer on an exercise regime

interventions.name: Dose esclated resistance training
interventions.description: All individuals will be engaging in resistance training during and/or after their cancer treatment

primaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in fat mass in pounds from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen via bioimpedance analysis
Determine changes in fat mass in pounds from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen via ultrasound
primaryOutcomes.description: Measurement via ultrasound and calculation with Jackson-Pollack calculations

primaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in muscle mass in pounds from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in overall score of functional movement screen (FMS) from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen
secondaryOutcomes.description: Determine changes in overall score of functional movement screen (FMS) from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in Y-balance score for each leg
secondaryOutcomes.description: Y-balance score adds up the distance each leg can move in the front and side directions, divided by the length of the hip. This correlates inversely with fall risk.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in strength via load measured in pounds from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen
secondaryOutcomes.description: Load is calculated by multiplying sets by repetitions by weight lifted for a specific exercise

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determine changes in EQ-5D responses 1-5 and overall score from before to after the nutrition and exercise regimen
secondaryOutcomes.description: EQ-5D asks 5 questions rates from 1-5 and an overall rating of health

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Age 20-89 years
2. Women of child-bearing potential must verbally confirm lack of pregnancy prior to enrollment. They should also consent to use adequate contraception during the course of the study.
3. Participants must be determined capable of engaging in resistance training by exercise personnel and/or study PI
4. Participants must complete an assessment by EOC staff and be determined safe to engage in the workout regimen by the study exercise personnel.
5. Individuals not deemed safe to participate in the standard EOC exercise program will be referred to physical therapy or elsewhere

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Severe arthritic, joint, cardiovascular, or musculoskeletal condition that would interfere with exercise program
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Individuals diagnosed with cancer on an exercise program at the AHN Exercise Oncology and Resiliency Center

locations.facility: AHN CI Exercise Oncology and Resiliency Center
